br.octahedron.cotopaxi.controller
Class Controller

java.lang.Object
  br.octahedron.cotopaxi.controller.InputController
      br.octahedron.cotopaxi.controller.Controller
Direct Known Subclasses:
ControllerInterceptor
public abstract class Controller
extends InputController

The base class for Controllers and Middleware controller. It provides access to input, session, header and cookies parameters/attributes, methods to redirect and render output. To implement this class you should extends this class and implement your handlers methods using "", e.g., "getUsers()". Your controller methods should has no parameters and should return void. To return results, simple call the out(String, Object) method to add an Object to output and after processing call the method render(String, int) or one of the shortcut methods (success, error, notFound, forbidden, invalid).

Author:
Danilo Queiroz - daniloqueiroz@octahedron.com.br

echo

protected final void echo()
It echos the input parameters to output, using the same names and values. If the parameter has multiple values it echos the values as a String Array. If the parameter has no value, it echos a blank ("") String.

currentUser

protected final void currentUser(String username)
Sets the given user name as the current user. This method is useful for authentication mechanisms

authorized

protected final void authorized()
Mark the request as authorized This method is useful for authorization mechanisms

setControllerResponse

protected final void setControllerResponse(ControllerResponse response)
Sets the ControllerResponse for the current request. This method should be used only by Controller extensions, avoid use this method directly when implementing a controller.

render

protected final void render(String template,
                            int code)
Renders the given template. It will use the objects set using the out(String, Object) to render the template. After render, the code continues to execute, and the code will be written to client only after the Controller execution flow ends.

Parameters:
template - the template file to be rendered
code - the http code
Throws:
IllegalStateException

jsonSuccess

protected final void jsonSuccess()
Renders out(String, Object) objects with SUCCESS (200) code The same as call asJSON(200)

jsonInvalid

protected final void jsonInvalid()
Renders out(String, Object) objects with BAD REQUEST (400) code The same as call asJSON(400)

asJSON

protected final void asJSON(int code)
Renders the objects set using the out(String, Object) as JSON format. After render, the code continues to execute, and the code will be written to client only after the Controller execution flow ends.

Parameters:
code - the http code
Throws:
IllegalStateException

redirect

protected final void redirect(String dest)
Redirects to the given url

Parameters:
dest - The redirect destination
